content.description:
Moss Monster climbs a nice but mossy boulder. This makes for a good warm-up for "

Hail to the Thief

". Sit start on hands, gain some fists, reach for a jug in the crack, and wrestle your way to the top.
content.location:
It is 50 yards NW of "

Hail to the Thief

."

GPS coordinates are: 39.335363, -105.271577.

content.description: An ultra flared out crack with almost nothing for hands, this one is all about the footwork! It is a bit mossy on the inside of the crack itself.
content.protection: A single pad will work fine.
content.location:
It is about 100 yards east (per

Kenny P

) of "

Big Wave Dave

."

content.description: Boogie Board climbs splitter hands with a finger crack move up top.
content.location: It is on the other side of the "Hang Ten" Boulder.

climbs.name: Big Wave Dave
climbs.fa: Tyler Dziedzina and Autumn, election day 2020

content.description:
This climbs an insanely good and laser-cut splitter on a boulder that looks like a wave in a beautiful forest setting.... The problem tackles a 45 degree left-leaning and 15 degree overhanging ringlocks to thin hands crack. Sit start as low as possible on an okay left, thin hand jam below a pod and a shitty right hand in the fingers bit, with an okay right foot hold. This problem requires a high level of body tension and good technique to be successful. It is short but mean and a bit easier than "

In Rainbows

" but not by much.... However some people have told me that this is the harder of the two climbs. Perhaps this one is hand- and foot-size dependent?

You can probably lay this one back, but it's more fun as a straight-in crack and way better in style.
content.location: GPS coordinates are: 39.335346, -105.271272. This is a standalone boulder in the forest away from the formation.
